@Robert_A_Wolfe @smdiehl Of course it was. But it did not get massive amounts of investment until the web came along as its killer app. And it was around for a long time before that. My point is that #Web3 is as if the big investment dollars had come during the era of FTP and telnet.

@Robert_A_Wolfe @smdiehl Of course it was. But you didn't have the explosion of consumer use cases until the web came along. That's when the VC money came in. In the case of #web3, the money arrived before the innovators discovered the opportunities.

@smdiehl That being said, technology does progress in layers. The internet was in its late teens when the World Wide Web was introduced. That was its first true killer app. So counting from the very beginning is probably not fair.
